intro: Rosa caryophyllacea f. friesiana, commonly known as the Friesian rose, is a compact, shrub-like plant native to southern Europe. It features small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has dark green, oval-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It is well-suited for rock gardens or containers due to its compact size and low maintenance requirements. The foliage remains attractive throughout the growing season, making it a desirable ornamental plant.
